Bert Wendland wrote:
> Hello everybody,
> 
> We are getting more and more difficulties to crawl particular hosts of
> the domain parti-socialiste.fr. After getting the host's DNS, the
> crawler blocks with "IOException: mark/reset not supported" (see
> below). The error is the same with 1.10.1 and 1.12.0., jre is
> 1.5.0_06-b05.
> 
> The problem began to occur a few days ago. So I guess they changed
> something on their servers that Heritrix cannot handle anymore. What
> can I do?

I think there are several issues here.

When I try to crawl the site, I don't get your error but I do get (for 
both robots and the root page):

=====================================================================
http://presse.parti-socialiste.fr/robots.txt 195.20.198.84 
20070321161951 text/html 1065
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Behavior
Date: Wed, 21 Mar 2007 16:18:04 GMT
Server: Apache
Status: 400 Bad Behavior
Content-Length: 892
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<title>HTTP Error 400</title>
</head>
<body>
<h1>Error 400</h1>
<p>We're sorry, but we could not fulfill your request for
/robots.txt on this server.</p>
<p>The automated program you are using is not permitted to access this 
server. Please use a different program or a standard Web browser.</p>
<p>Your technical support key is: <strong>43b4-cbd4-7ad0-4a8a</strong></p>
<p>You can use this key to <a 
href="http://www.ioerror.us/bb2-support-key?key=43b4-cbd4-7ad0-4a8a">fix 
this problem yourself</a>.</p>
<p>If you are unable to fix the problem yourself, please contact <a 
href="mailto:julien.bezille+nospam@...">julien.bezille at 
free.fr</a> and be sure to provide the technical support key shown 
above.</p>
=====================================================================

They appear to be using a PHP plug-in called 'Bad Behavior' which aims 
to detect and block misbehaving robots.

That I received the above error on my first try, even while respecting 
robots, indicates that the plug-in may have a built-in configuration 
against the 'heritrix' user-agent.

Your error may be the result of an even-more strict countermeasure they 
are taking against your user-agent or IP ranges, based on either a 
perception that you are not following robots or over-crawling their site.

So, I believe the shortest route to resolving this problem will be to 
take it up with the site webmaster.

The form of the error you are receiving is strange to me; the 
InputStream inside our HttpConnection should support mark/reset. So it 
is possible that their countermeasure is exercising a code path in 
Heritrix with a heretofore unknown bug. (Perhaps a retry triggered by 
their actions is skipping our usual wrapping.)

I will create an issue and continue to investigating this error stack, 
but given the message I received I believe even if this stack is 
resolved, you will have trouble crawling this site unless the webmaster 
adjusts their countermeasures.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

> Thanks for help,
>   Bert
> 
>
